alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 8:34AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in South Dakota... James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Columbia. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, significant amounts of agricultural lands are flooded * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM CDT Wednesday was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.1 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Sunday, August 27th.
